Network connections to domains exhibitin.Action: Analyze Zeek dns.log for unusual DNS query patterns (e.g., sudden query volume spikes to new domains, queries for domains with recent registration changes if external intel is available). Correlate with Zeek conn.log to identify internal hosts communicating with these domains. Use correlation analysis to identify hosts communicating with multiple newly observed or suspicious domains.

Connections to external infrastructure d.Action: Scan Zeek conn.log and Zeek ssl.log for connections to external IP addresses and ports matching known C2 patterns or indicators from threat intelligence feeds. Use correlation analysis to identify internal hosts connecting to multiple suspect external C2 IPs/domains. Identify unique SSL certificates observed in Zeek ssl.log for connections to suspect IPs and cross-reference against known malicious certificates.

Connections to frequently visited or hig.Action: Maintain a list of frequently visited or high-reputation external domains accessed by internal hosts based on historical Zeek http.log/conn.log data (e.g., using frequency analysis/percentiles). Cross-reference this list periodically against threat intelligence feeds or open-source reporting identifying compromised websites, infrastructure used for malvertizing, or staging areas. Flag internal connections (Zeek conn.log, http.log) to these domains that match the compromise period or specific suspicious paths/parameters identified in intel.

Internal systems connecting to external.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log; Zeek files.log
Internal systems connecting to external.Action: Monitor Zeek logs (conn.log, http.log) for connections to external services often used for staging (e.g., known IPs/domains for pastebins, specific cloud storage URLs, code repositories) from internal systems, particularly unusual connections or activity patterns. Cross-reference destination IPs/domains with threat intelligence. Use Zeek files.log to identify suspicious file transfers during these sessions. Use frequency analysis to identify outlier internal hosts or external destinations showing rare connections to these types of services.
